content:
I'd like to have aesop? exhausively search (under specified rulesets and step limit, of course) all proofs for a proposition, i.e. do not stop after success, record the proof tree and keep going until exhaustion/limit, and print all proofs.

The situation will be similar to the last few lines of https://gist.github.com/wenkokke/cc12b92a8a60696b712c#file-main-agda-L863 where different proof of the same goal results in non-trivial difference in the result saught after (the more the better).

Is this possible?
